newsitem.title: TURKEY: Bomb found on Turkish army site kills child.
newsitem.headline: Bomb found on Turkish army site kills child.

text.p: One child was killed and four were hurt when a bomb they found on an army shooting range in Turkey's southeast province of Erzurum exploded after they took it home, the state-run Anatolian news agency said on Thursday.

It said the children found the bomb near their house in Pasinler township. Four-year-old Fedia Ogurce died and four other children in the family, aged between six and 12, were badly hurt and taken to hospital.
Anatolian said security officials had begun to search houses in the township after rumours that other children had picked up bombs from the shooting range.
More than 22,000 people have been killed in over 12 years of fighting between government troops and Kurdish rebels seeking self-rule in the mainly Kurdish southeast.
